page.title: 17An Old Lady Remembers
page.content: Mrs. Jenny Peat aged 84 has lived in or near Kirkfieldbank all her life.She went to the village primary school which she remembers as being strict and where there were coal fires in each classroom.The children wrote on slates as there were few pencils.As a child she worked at picking fruit during the summer holidays, strawberry and gooseberry and for which she was paid about 3/_(15p)per week.The row of houses in which she lived is still there; it is known locally as "Dublin" probably after the Irish labourers who built it. Her mother died in 1920 during the worldwide infenza epidemic she had to give up her job in a Lanark factory to look after her six young brothers and sisters.She thinks children of 1985 are better dressed, and have now more freedom.
